description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b9952","text":"We present a step-by-step methodology for tracking the coverage of the IRIS dataset in the OpenCitations Corpus. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27qtd","text":"The methodology filters the original IRIS dataset and the OpenCitations Meta and Index dumps, producing two novel dataset containing the data that are then queried to answer the 5 research questions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5pess","text":"Make sure that the IRIS dump is present in the work directory.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a58n5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"376jv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6td2i","text":"This step will create a version of the OpenCitations Meta dump that is transformed and filtered according to the elements in the IRIS dump. This new dataset is stored in a parquet format that makes it lean and fast to query. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ets9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6iqj0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8em3k","text":"If you want to skip the creation of the dataset, you can download the final dataset here","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":84,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"fv7sc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55tf1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1CEB5C3423354164A918DC13EB08F2D8","url":"http://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.25879420"}},"1":{"type":"dataset","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"affiliation":null,"can_edit":true,"guid":"64B0A46F19D811EFAE230A58A9FEAC02","link":"https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.25879420","name":"Iris in Meta"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ie22","text":"This step will create a version of the OpenCitations Index dump that is transformed and filtered according to the elements in the Iris in Meta dataset. This new dataset is also stored in a parquet format.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9iq0u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1p4k","text":"If you want to skip the creation of the dataset, you can download the final dataset here","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":84,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"276lr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8qan7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1CEB5C3423354164A918DC13EB08F2D8","url":"http://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.25879441"}},"1":{"type":"dataset","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"affiliation":null,"can_edit":true,"guid":"64B28C3719D811EFAE230A58A9FEAC02","link":"https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.25879441","name":"Iris in Index"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8i4sq","text":"The purpose of this step is to read each CSV file in the Meta dump and process it by applying the following operations:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3evq1","text":"Select the ['id', 'title', 'type'] columns","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":19,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4r8g","text":"Extract from the 'id' column the omid, and the doi, isbn and pmid if present through a regex pattern search. These 4 different elements are inserted into a new column created for each. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":18,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":33,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":47,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3u867","text":"Create a new 'id' column by combining the 'doi', 'isbn', and 'pmid' columns, preferring the first non-null value.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":14,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":62,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpmg","text":"Get rid of the 'doi', 'isbn', and 'pmid' columns","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":35,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b7nk","text":"Remove null values from the new 'id' column","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4p7tl","text":"Perform an inner join with the dois_isbns_pmids dataframe","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":31,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsqb7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6coob","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eqsi","text":"7. Write the resulting dataframe to a .parquet file.
